mortality.note: UN estimates 300,000. 2.7 million displaced. First ICC arrest warrant for sitting head of state (Omar al-Bashir, 2009). Violence continues at lower levels. Main genocide phase 2003-2008.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Janjaweed militias, aerial bombing, forced displacement. Government-coordinated.
rationales.profit: Land and resources, but primarily counter-insurgency.
rationales.ideology: Arab supremacism against African groups. Racial dimensions.
rationales.complicity: Sudanese government, China blocked UN action. ICC indicted Bashir. Sudan denies.

analysis.pattern_note: First genocide of 21st century. Arab supremacist ideology - Janjaweed ('devils on horseback') armed by Khartoum. Villages burned, wells poisoned, women systematically raped. China and Russia blocked UN intervention (oil interests). ICC issued arrest warrant for al-Bashir - first for sitting president. Shows genocide can happen under international scrutiny with impunity.
analysis.root_causes: Arab supremacism, competition for land/water, counter-insurgency, government complicity

sources.title: Darfur: A New History of a Long War
sources.author: Julie Flint & Alex de Waal
